entry.title: im back....hopefully
entry.content:
Yea, I haven't really posted anything for a longgg time. But now that im basically addicted to blogger, maybe I'll remember to post on this more often.

Here's something small I just noticed today while writing a paper for school. Teachers always say that papers must be "Neatly typed". Is the word "neatly" really required. Can you "messily" type a paper. Computers normally take care of that whole messy thing with something called FONTS. Unless you create your own font that is messy handwriting, but mainly all the fonts I've ever used are quite neat. So seriously, stop saying neatly typed.

entry.title: small pockets, pictures and other such matters...
entry.content:
So yea, I haven't posted anything in a while, so I got a few to write about.

***First....why the F do they put those small pockets in jeans? Seriously, it does absolutely nothing. You can't fit anything in it. Not even a pen. I suppose you could put like coins in there if u wanted to, but who the hell just carries change around loose like that? That's why somebody smarter than the person who invented the small pocket invented something called a 'wallet'. For real, if anybody knows that the purpose of it is, please leave a comment and tell me, cus its the dumbest thing ever. Like, I guess you could use it to clip a pen onto, but then why is it an actual pocket? You could very well just clip a pen onto a belt or......wow, get this...the big pocket! Watev, if I had my own jeans company, I would rid the world of the small pocket.

***Second...what is with the John Tesh radio show? Has anybody actually listened to him? It's basically a crappy syndicated show where Mr. Johnny Tesh tells you random bits of information and then plays the same music that the station normally plays. Do you know what the slogan to the show is?? If it won't improve some part of your life, you won't hear it on this show.

W
T
F

The first time I ever listened to that show the first thing I heard him tell the audience was the angle that the Tower of Pisa leaned at. MY LIFE WAS CHANGED! It's the stupidest show ever. Bragging bastard.

***Third...How come people always think that pictures will miraculously come out better if you dress up for them? Isn't a picture supposed to be an accurate representation of yourself at a given moment in time? So why don't we just take pictures in our every day clothes?

Exhibit A: My senior pictures - According to parents, I should dress up all fancy because were 'paying lots of money'. Well ya know wat, it makes no sense to pay lots of money to have a picture taken of me that isn't me. Do I wear clothes like that normally? No. So it's pointless to create a false image of yourself in a picture. Pictures should portray you as accurately as they can.

There are probly more things that I feel like complaining about but my fingers hurt from typing all this.

Next up....vacation in Maine. Lata.

link.title: small pockets, pictures and other such matters...

entry.title: Modern Bride?
entry.content:
Ok, so the other day I noticed there is actually a magazine called Modern Bride. Think about what the magazine is about, and then think about the subject of being a bride.

Normally, when you subscribe to a magazine, it's like a one year subscription or something like that. Why in the hell would you need to pay money for a magazine for an event that will happen in less than 3-4 months? Seriously, they should give away 2 issues to people, so that they don't have to waste their money on 10 out of 12 issues that will never be used.

While we're on the subject of magazines, take a look at this. I was on a site that supposedly gives away free subscriptions (who would have guessed...scam). But here is their 'Browse by Category' list for new magazines.



Yea, that's right. Harry Potter has its own freakin category in a list of generalities such as video games and relationships. And seriously, how many magazines can there be on Harry Potter...? Well, apparentely twenty-freakin-two of em. That's just rediculous. I'm not rankin on the books or anything, I'll be the first to say I've read all of them more than once, but seriously. Why don't I just go write an entire magazine on why 'Thomas the Tank Engine' is so cool? And after that, 21 more people can do the same thing. That way, when people want to read a magazine about a book, they will have 22 selections.

Gimme a break.

entry.title: in light of recent holidays...
entry.content:
Okay...so sunday was fathers day...or should I say "Fathers Day". Yes. A nationally recognized day. Now, I'm not bashing on fathers, because dads are way cool. Mine is anyways. And if it weren't for fathers, than many of us....wait....all of us, would not be here.

What I'm getting to here though is the fact that the offspring....the sons and daughters have absolutely no motivation. Why isn't there a "Sons Day" or a "Daughters Day" ? Where is my motivation to reproduce and become a father? Don't you think women would like just a little encouragement from a holiday to go through hours of painful labor to bring a newborn child into the world?

I would certainly think so.

Or maybe it doesn't even have to be so direct as "Sons Day". Something like "Possibly a Father Day" or "Fathers Offspring Day" would do fine as well. I don't know, but I certainly feel that I deserve more credit for growing up to become a dad. And holidays are the best way to do that.

Because that is what we do in America. Somebody is cool or awesome, we name a holiday after them. Martin Luther King Day? Exactly. Or Christmas. Wait...no. That is definitely an inappropriately named holiday. Shouldn't it be like "Santa Day"? Continuing...Arbor Day? Yea...I bet you all didn't know about John Arbor, the most famous figure in American history...(he didn't make it into textbooks for some reason...every single one).

Well...even if there aren't that many holidays named after people....we definitely are a country that loves holidays, which is why if you look at a calendar theres some unknown holiday like every day of the year. For example....today is national "Ice Cream Soda Day".....I am not joking, look here. Ok...I'm done now.

I have to go get ready for national finals suck day.

entry.title: cut the extra talk.....please....
entry.content:
Okay, as a general rule of thumb people, please...when somebody asks you a question, don't say anything more than you need to say. Because I'll tell you what, when somebody asks you a question, they only want to know what they ask, not a million other things that you start rambling on about after you answer the initial question.

When I ask somebody a question, I can listen to the answer for about 5 seconds, during which period my ears are alert and open to any important information that may enter them. After that I don't have the time to listen anymore, seriously. So just say what needs to be said and move on with your day, no sense wasting extra time saying things that nobody cares about.

Also I thought I would take this time to point out a few things I thought of today...

- When somebody is in a rush to eat DO NOT talk to them, they don't want to talk to you.

- A person saying they are tired is like a secret code for 'i dont really feel like talking'

- Librarians are never in a good mood......ever.

- And finally, chemistry is the most useless class I have EVER taken. period.

entry.title: pfffttt....
entry.content:
Okay, I want everybody to take a second and think of the most not-cool, secluded state in our country without looking below. Think nice and real hard, of the most neglected state we have.

Ok....ready???


Did you choose South Dakota? If u did, then your right. If you didn't...it's probably because you forgot it was a state.

Seriously, South Dakota is like the lowliest state. I mean, I'm sure the people that live there are awesome (don't take any of this personal if you read this and your from SD), but seriously, your state is the most boring place on earth....or Earth....yea, Earth sounds way better than earth.

I mean, the state is freakin huge (the 17th biggest) yet has only a population of 754,844, which also happens to the 45th largest....

If you do some math, that's 51 - 45 = 6. Therefore, South Dakota is the 6th smallest state. That makes South Dakota seem alot more crappy than the 45th largest.

The state insect is a bee. Seriously....a bee. Even better...ya know wat the state fossil is? That's right, the state fossil. I didn't even know that states had an official fossil, but apparently they do.

IT'S THE TRICERATOPS....QUOTE "A three-horned plant-eating dinosaur from the late Cretaceous period"

Dude, if you can pick your own state fossil, pick something cool like a teradactyl or a big dinosaur that owns everybody else, not a freakin vegetarian dinosaur. That's like picking a tick for your team mascot....they're just not cool.

The only cool thing in South Dakota is Mount Rushmore, and that's only cool cus it's big faces carved into rock, and also because four of the best presidents ever are carved into it. Ya know what I can tell you for a fact...you'll never see George Bush's face carved into a rock. (That has nothing to do with anything, but I just wanted to make sure everybody was aware that GB is not the kind of president they make rocks out of).

But anyway, I'm not saying that CT is any better....because it's not. In fact, we probly suck even more hardcore.

But for real....South Dakota sucks.

END.

entry.title: stupidest thing ever...
entry.content:
Alright, I'm pretty sure most of you will be able to relate to this, cus it happens all the time and I'm gettin friggin sick of it.

So, your sitting in class, and the teacher hands something. Naturally, everybody complains. THEN, the teacher proceeds to say the following:

"O come on you guys, I don't think it's too hard"

Does anybody else find this illogical? I mean, come on. YOU WENT TO OVER 6 YEARS OF SCHOOLING IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO TEACH US!! OF COURSE YOUR NOT GOING TO FIND IT HARD

I mean seriously, if anybody finds it hard, it's going to be us, the students.....not the teacher. I'm sick of the teacher always being like 'WAH WAH its not hard stop complaining'. I'm pretty sure if they said 'This is really hard' then I would think they were a pretty crappy teacher.

entry.title: Nutrition labelS
entry.content:
Ok, this is what companies need to stop doing. The example I'm going to use is a Monster Energy Drink.

Please take note that I am not complaining at all about Monster, they're awesome, and truthfully I wouldn't have even been awake for SAT's if I didn't drink one of em.

So anyway, first, take a look at this nutrition label.


You'll notice up on the top, hidden there underneath the Serving Size of 8.0 fl. oz. or 240 mL (is that really necessary? I mean seriously, who cares about the milliliters of something they drank. or the fl. ounces, for that matter) is the Servings Per Container. It says '2' as you can see.

Ok, so for one, this is a non-resealable can. Second, anybody who is awesome enough to buy an energy drink, is not going to drink half of it and then save the rest for later. OF COURSE NOT. When you buy a can of something like this, you drink the ENTIRE THING.

Would you drink companies just put down '1' for the servings for container? Seriously, it could say 2332.24 servings per container and people are still going to drink the entire thing. And besides, you could probly save a few cents on ink because a '1' requires less ink than a '2'.

sorry if only i find this stupid, im so tired right now i could eat the can after i drink the soda and not notice

entry.title: listen up all you writers!
entry.content:
Look, for all you retards who write literary critiques for a living. For one, God Bless You. I can't imagine going to a job that would suck any harder than that every day.

But the thing I'm really trying to say here is....stop writing responses to poems and short stories that are longer than the actual story or poem itself. NOBODY wants to read a critique of a poem that is longer than the poem. Because I'm pretty sure that's why they would have read a poem in the first place, so they only had to spend one minute of their life reading it.

Now, if you take this quick one minute reading poem, and spend a year of your life writing a 300 page response to it, encorporating all this garbage about significance and symbolism, you seriously need to just kill yourself. Why the hell would you put yourself through that? I would probably have more fun punching myself in the mouth over and over than writing a 300 page critique of a poem, no joke.

If your going to write a 300 page critique of anything, do it of something cool at least....like Calvin and Hobbes. And plus, the amount of money you make wasting a year of your life writing that crap is probably less than I make in a year, and I don't even have a job.

You only got one life on this planet guys and girls, let's use it wisely and have some fun.*


* May be interpreted in a spirtitual or motivational way if desired.

entry.title: for real people...
entry.content:
Seriously, people need to stop saying things that contain two yes or no questions in one sentence.

I don't know about other people, but this pisses the hell out of me. When somebody asks me a question, I need to be able to either
1) nod yes
OR
2) nod no

As soon as people combine their two questions into one jumbled mess of inquisitiveness, I'm forced to indicate the question I am referring to before giving my reply. And then if you don't indicate the question, the other person is always like "what are you saying no/yes to?".

WELL MAYBE YOU WOULD KNOW WHAT I WAS SAYING YES OR NO TO IF YOU HAD LIMITED YOUR SENTENCE TO ONE QUESTION.

I'm tired alot as it is, so I certainly don't need to take the time and energy to do anything more than nod.

entry.title: FRickin welcome centers
entry.content:
Okay, so I just got back from my place in Vermont. If you've ever gone into Vermont on whatever that major highway is, you know they have the most kick ass welcome centers ever. I mean....giant parking lot...playscape for the kiddies...lots of informational stuff inside about the history of cows...like 10 soda and snack machines. Shit, they even got an area reserved for dogs to take craps. Now that is high class.

So here I am praising these welcome centers. I'm sure Vermont isn't the only state that has nice welcome centers. I've never been out of the northeast besides Florida, and there aren't typically welcome centers when your on a plane....

But you know what I realized? Where the F are the goodbye centers? These welcome centers...you enter the state and they greet you like a faithful dog does his master. They thank you for coming to visit their state and provide you with all of the information you would ever need to stay in that state for the rest of your life.

However....as were are leaving the state, there is nothing, not even a simple rest stop, with like the crappy bathrooms and racks full of pamphlets to thank us for taking time out of our life to visit their wonderful land of promise. Now how's that for inviting us back again? If you ask me, they should be spending more time thanking us for visiting than they do for welcoming us. I mean, when you come to a welcome center, your already in the state, your not going to turn around and go back. Maybe if states put in Goodbye Centers (possibly a name slightly more creative) and gave away some type of thank you basket for everybody who stopped in....say like a new lisence plate frame or somethin, a sticker perhaps...we would return to those states again and when we thought of them think back and say...."boy, i'd really like to go back there some time..."

Well, that is all kids, time for bed.

entry.title: Chemistry........o god.
entry.content:
Alright, I've probly said this a million times this year and I've most likely complained to most people about it already, but I have to say it again because I can't get over it.

Seriously, chemistry sucks like a bad superhero movie. (see Hellboy, Batman, The Hulk, Daredevil, etc.) I mean, the only thing that I might possibly get out of that class and use later in life is..........hmm.

Um, I'll get back to you all on that.

Last week I learned how to use titration to find the equivalance point of an acid and a base so that I could find the concentration, otherwise known as molarity, of an unknown concentration of base, Sodium Hydroxide, NaOH.

I'll be damned if I ever need to that in my working job 10 years from now. If your a chemist, god bless you, and not just for sneezing. If your a chemist and your actually reading this....well....I have nothing else to say to you, and would you please exit this rant by clicking here.

I took it because people told me it helps for thinking like an engineer, which I was interested in at the beginning of this year. That's completely not true, unless I was an engineer who set up lab stations and mixed chemicals together so that I can make pointless conclusions about which compound Mystery Solution #4 is.

If you've never taken chemistry.....DONT.

entry.title: And so it has come to be...
entry.content:
Well, basically I realized the other day that there's at least one thing every day that I notice or point out to myself that I find stupid or that just bugs me. Ya know? Little idiosyncrasies of our world that get on my nerves. Ok, with that being said, here is the first.
_______________________________________________________________

Alright, basically everybody has registered for some kinda thing on the internet. A forum, a site for school, a porn site (hahahah) .....whatever.

And of course, there is always the pull down box asking you to choose which country you are from. Now....some of the sites have the United States at the top. Others, however, feel that in order to make it more fair to computer users in other countries, they need to put the US in it's proper order...at the freakin bottom of the list.

You know what the first country on the lists are? Afghanistan...AFGHANISTAN!!! Head on over to the CIA World Fact Book site and check out these stats.
Population ----- 29,928,987
Internet Users ----- 1000

Okay, so there are 1000 internet users out of the nearly 30 million people in that freakin country. How many internet users ya think we got here in the good ol US of A?
159,000,000
Yep, thats right...the number of people who use in the internet in our country is 5 times greater than the population of their country.

Does Afghanistan really need to fill the first spot on that list? Come on guys, seriously. Just put us at the top. We invented the internet, that should be one liberty we are allowed to take. I really am getting tired of having to grab the little scroll button and pull it alllll the way down just to click on the country I'm from.

Thank you....

P.S. Since this is the first post, I am going to say this. Please comment

link.title: And so it has come to be...

entry.title: Regardless of the order of the list, if you simply...
entry.content:
Regardless of the order of the list, if you simply type the first letter of the country you want, it'll jump to that section of the list. Pressing the same letter again will jump to the next country starting with that letter, and so on...

Generally, pressing the 'U' five times gets you "United States" if it's not at the top of the list.

as strong as Balsa, which makes it great for construction. It also has
the unique ability to regrow itself from the stump, minimizing the land and
time to replant and develop new root systems.

Based on current resources and agreements, EGTY projects revenues of $140
Million with an approximate profit margin of 40% for each 9-year cycle. With
anticipated growth, EGTY is expected to challenge Deltic Timber Corp. during
its initial 9-year cycle.

Deltic Timber Corp. currently trades at over $38.00 a share with about $153
Million in revenues. As the reputation and demand for the Global Cedar tree
continues to grow around the world EGTY believes additional multi-million
dollar agreements will be forthcoming. The Global Cedar nursery has produced
about 100,000 infant plants and is developing a production growth target of
250,000 infant plants per month.

Energy and Asset Technology is currently in negotiations with land and business
owners in New Zealand, Greece and Malaysia regarding the purchase of their popular
and profitable fast growing infant tree plants. Inquiries from the governments of
Brazil and Ecuador are also being evaluated.

Conclusion:

The examples above show the Awesome, Earning Potential of little
known Companies That Explode onto Investors Radar Screens.
This s-t0ck will not be a Secret for long. Then You May Feel the Desire to Act Right
Now! And Please Watch This One Trade!!


GO EGTY!
